name: Drain Life
text:
Spend only black mana on X.
Drain Life deals X damage to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more life than the player's life total before Drain Life dealt damage or the creature's toughness.

name: Drainpipe Vermin
text: When Drainpipe Vermin dies, you may pay {B}. If you do, target player discards a card.

editions.flavor: When times are tough, the poor eat the rats. When times are tougher, the rats eat the poor.

name: Drain Power
text: Target player activates a mana ability of each land he or she controls. Then put all mana from that player's mana pool into yours.

name: Drain the Well
text: Destroy target land. You gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: Trows have learned that it's not wise to eat cinders without a bucket or two of water nearby.

name: Drake Familiar
text:
Flying
When Drake Familiar enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an enchantment to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor:
"Falconry? A fine sport I suppose, if you're attracted to the frailty of birds."
—Trivaz, Izzet mage

name: Drake Hatchling
text:
Flying
{U}: Drake Hatchling gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

editions.flavor: There is beauty in the space between learning to fly and taking it for granted.

name: Drake-Skull Cameo
text: {T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"A strange skull was turned up by an Ephran farmer's plow. I traded a copper ring for the ‘ox skull.' It resonates of the sea and danger."
—Isel, master carver

name: Drakestown Forgotten
text:
Drakestown Forgotten enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the number of creature cards in all graveyards.
{2}{B}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Drakestown Forgotten: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

name: Drake Umbra
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 and has flying.
Totem armor (If enchanted creature would be destroyed, instead remove all damage from it and destroy this Aura.)

name: Drakewing Krasis
text: Flying, trample

editions.flavor: Cautious not to repeat Vig's mistakes, the Simic fuse life essences using magic alone. Each result is called a krasis.

name: Dralnu, Lich Lord
text:
If damage would be dealt to Dralnu, Lich Lord, sacrifice that many permanents instead.
{T}: Target instant or sorcery card in your graveyard gains flashback until end of turn. The flashback cost is equal to its mana cost. (You may cast that card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Dralnu's Crusade
text:
Goblin creatures get +1/+1.
All Goblins are black and are Zombies in addition to their other creature types.

editions.flavor:
"Don't you agree that mogg intellects are improved by zombification?"
—Lord Dralnu

name: Dralnu's Pet
text:
Kicker—{2}{B}, Discard a creature card. (You may pay {2}{B} and discard a creature card in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
If Dralnu's Pet was kicked, it enters the battlefield with flying and with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the discarded card's converted mana cost.

name: Dramatic Entrance
text: You may put a green creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.

editions.flavor: Some things aren't worth waiting for.

name: Dramatic Rescue
text: Return target creature to its owner's hand. You gain 2 life.

editions.flavor:
"I never thought I'd be so glad to see two tons of beak and claws bearing down on me at the speed of an arrow."
—Mirela, Azorius hussar

name: Dramatic Reversal
text: Untap all nonland permanents you control.

editions.flavor:
"Nobody asked you to butt in, Jace. But thanks."
—Chandra Nalaar

name: Drana, Kalastria Bloodchief
text:
Flying
{X}{B}{B}: Target creature gets -0/-X until end of turn and Drana, Kalastria Bloodchief gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "If our former masters would have us kneel again, they shall feel our defiance slashed across their membranes."
"If our former masters would have us kneel again, they shall feel our defiance slashed across their membranes."

name: Drana, Liberator of Malakir
text:
Flying, first strike
Whenever Drana, Liberator of Malakir deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on each attacking creature you control.

editions.flavor: "I will not live as a slave. If you would be free, then fight alongside me."
"I will not live as a slave. If you would be free, then fight alongside me."

name: Drana's Chosen
text: Cohort — {T}, Tap an untapped Ally you control: Create a tapped 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

editions.flavor: "Drana commands me. I command my nulls. And so her bidding is done."

name: Drana's Emissary
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: "The taste of freedom is sweeter than blood."

name: Drastic Revelation
text: Discard your hand. Draw seven cards, then discard three cards at random.

editions.flavor: Every disaster holds mystery, for lack of a sane witness.

name: Drawn Together
text:
As Drawn Together comes into play, choose an artist.
Creatures by the chosen artist get +2/+2.

editions.flavor:
"My Pete Venters theme deck is nearly complete. Then I shall be unstoppable Bwahahahaaa"
—Pete Venters

name: Dread
text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Whenever a creature deals damage to you, destroy it.
When Dread is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.

name: Dreadbore
text: Destroy target creature or planeswalker.

editions.flavor: In Rakdos-controlled neighborhoods, everyone is part of the show.

name: Dreadbringer Lampads
text: Constellation — Whenever Dreadbringer Lampads or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, target creature gains intimidate until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)

name: Dread Cacodemon
text: When Dread Cacodemon enters the battlefield, if you cast it from your hand, destroy all creatures your opponents control, then tap all other creatures you control.

editions.flavor: Those who hear its roar perish. The lucky ones only feel its fetid breath.

name: Dread Charge
text: Black creatures you control can't be blocked this turn except by black creatures.

editions.flavor: "As equal were their souls, so equal was their fate." —John Dryden, "Ode to Mrs. Anne Killigrew"

name: Dread Defiler
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
{3}{C}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Target opponent loses life equal to the exiled card's power. ({C} represents colorless mana.)

editions.flavor: It left behind an echoing emptiness more horrible than the grave.
It left behind an echoing emptiness more horrible than the grave.

name: Dread Drone
text: When Dread Drone enters the battlefield, create two 0/1 colorless Eldrazi Spawn creature tokens. They have "Sacrifice this creature: Add {C} to your mana pool."

editions.flavor: Each Eldrazi ancient spawned a lineage of horrors in unfathomable shapes.
Each Eldrazi ancient spawned a lineage of horrors in unfathomable shapes.

name: Dread of Night
text: White creatures get -1/-1.

editions.flavor:
"These moonless, foreign skies keep me in thrall. Dark whispers echo in the night, and I cannot resist."
—Selenia, dark angel

"These moonless, foreign skies keep me in thrall. Dark whispers echo in the night, and I cannot resist."
—Selenia, dark angel

name: Dread Reaper
text:
Flying
When Dread Reaper enters the battlefield, you lose 5 life.

name: Dread Return
text:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
Flashback—Sacrifice three creatures. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

editions.flavor: Those who forget the horrors of the past are doomed to re-meet them.
Those who forget the horrors of the past are doomed to re-meet them.
The will to return can overpower the will to survive.
Those who forget the horrors of the past are doomed to re-meet them.

name: Dreadship Reef
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Put a storage counter on Dreadship Reef.
{1}, Remove X storage counters from Dreadship Reef: Add X mana in any combination of {U} and/or {B} to your mana pool.

name: Dread Slag
text:
Trample
Dread Slag gets -4/-4 for each card in your hand.

editions.flavor: A thousand phobias sopped from the city and wrung from Rix Maadi as one.

name: Dread Slaver
text: Whenever a creature dealt damage by Dread Slaver this turn dies, return it to the battlefield under your control. That creature is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types.

editions.flavor: Half a brain rules the mindless.

name: Dread Specter
text: Whenever Dread Specter blocks or becomes blocked by a nonblack creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

editions.flavor:
Whatever follows life is incurable.
—Zhalfirin aphorism

name: Dread Statuary
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{4}: Dread Statuary becomes a 4/2 Golem artifact creature until end of turn. It's still a land.

editions.flavor: The last reliable landmark in Tazeem just walked away.
The last reliable landmark in Tazeem just walked away.
The last reliable landmark in Tazeem just walked away.

name: Dread Summons
text: Each player puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard. For each creature card put into a graveyard this way, you create a tapped 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

editions.flavor: "Did you have a nice nap?"—Liliana Vess

name: Dread Warlock
text: Dread Warlock can't be blocked except by black creatures.

editions.flavor: "I don't know who to pity more: those who flee from my presence or the damned who can withstand it."

name: Dreadwaters
text: Target player puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard, where X is the number of lands you control.

editions.flavor: Stray into the Morkrut and it may rise to claim you.
Stray into the Morkrut and it may rise to claim you.

name: Dread Wight
text: At end of combat, put a paralyzation counter on each creature blocking or blocked by Dread Wight and tap those creatures. Each of those creatures doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as it has a paralyzation counter on it. Each of those creatures gains "{4}: Remove a paralyzation counter from this creature."

name: Dreadwing
text: {1}{U}{R}: Dreadwing gets +3/+0 and gains flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Dreadwings spring from lofty perches to surprise kathari in midflight. They smother their prey and then consume it as they glide gently toward the ground.

name: Dreamborn Muse
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard, where X is the number of cards in his or her hand.

editions.flavor:
"Her voice is insight, piercing and true."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor

"Her voice is insight, piercing and true."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor

"Her voice is insight, piercing and true."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor

name: Dream Cache
text: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand both on top of your library or both on the bottom of your library.

editions.flavor:
Dreams' riches are easily spent.
—Suq'Ata adage

"The sanctity of poverty is an invention of the rich."
—Starke

Dreams' riches are easily spent.
—Suq'Ata adage

name: Dreamcatcher
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may sacrifice Dreamcatcher. If you do, draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"Be careful where your mind wanders. Even in the quietest moments, the kami are listening, and your thoughts give them shape."
—Lady Azami

name: Dream Chisel
text: Face-down creature spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

editions.flavor: Itself a product of Ixidor's tortured psyche, the chisel brings his darkest dreams to life.

name: Dream Coat
text:
Enchant creature
{0}: Enchanted creature becomes the color or colors of your choice. Activate this ability only once each turn.

editions.flavor: "Adopt the character of the twisting octopus, which takes on the appearance of the nearby rock. Now follow in this direction, now turn a different hue." —Theognis, Elegies 1, 215

name: Dream Fighter
text: Whenever Dream Fighter blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, Dream Fighter and that creature phase out. (While they're phased out, they're treated as though they don't exist. Each one phases in before its controller untaps during his or her next untap step.)

editions.flavor: Not only the sleeping should fear dreams.

name: Dream Fracture
text:
Counter target spell. Its controller draws a card.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"Creation is a paradox. It hatches from its opposite."
—Olka, Mistmeadow witch

"Creation is a paradox. It hatches from its opposite."
—Olka, Mistmeadow witch

name: Dream Halls
text: Rather than pay the mana cost for a spell, its controller may discard a card that shares a color with that spell.

editions.flavor: Within without.
Within without.

name: Dream Leash
text:
Enchant permanent
You can't choose an untapped permanent as Dream Leash's target as you cast Dream Leash.
You control enchanted permanent.

editions.flavor: The tendrils of sorcery find easy purchase on the soft underbelly of dreams.

name: Dream Pillager
text:
Flying
Whenever Dream Pillager deals combat damage to a player, exile that many cards from the top of your library. Until end of turn, you may cast nonland cards exiled this way.

editions.flavor: Its wings shimmer with dreams absorbed from its enemies.

name: Dreampod Druid
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if Dreampod Druid is enchanted, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.

editions.flavor: "Don't mistake my creations for mere vegetation. They are my children, loyal and fierce."
"Don't mistake my creations for mere vegetation. They are my children, loyal and fierce."
"Don't mistake my creations for mere vegetation. They are my children, loyal and fierce."

name: Dream Prowler
text: Dream Prowler can't be blocked as long as it's attacking alone.

editions.flavor:
"To think that some find sleep a restful state."
—Volrath

"To think that some find sleep a restful state."
—Volrath

"To think that some find sleep a restful state."
—Volrath

name: Dream Salvage
text: Draw cards equal to the number of cards target opponent discarded this turn.

editions.flavor: Awylla tried hard to forget the horrors she had seen, but someone else had developed a keen interest in them.

name: Dreamscape Artist
text: {2}{U}, {T}, Discard a card, Sacrifice a land: Search your library for up to two basic land cards and put them onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: He's mastered the art of sleight of land.

name: Dream's Grip
text:
Choose one —
• Tap target permanent.
• Untap target permanent.
Entwine {1} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

name: Dreams of the Dead
text: {1}{U}: Return target white or black creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. That creature gains "Cumulative upkeep {2}." If the creature would leave the battlefield, exile it instead of putting it anywhere else. (At the beginning of its controller's upkeep, that player puts an age counter on it, then sacrifices it unless he or she pays its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

name: Dreamspoiler Witches
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a spell during an opponent's turn, you may have target creature get -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: At night, the faeries steal dreamstuff for their queen. At daybreak, countless creatures wake weak and hollow.
At night, the faeries steal dreamstuff for their queen. At daybreak, countless creatures wake weak and hollow.

name: Dream Stalker
text: When Dream Stalker enters the battlefield, return a permanent you control to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: What happens when it is the dream that wakes and the sleeper that fades into memory?
What happens when it is the dream that wakes and the sleeper that fades into memory?

name: Dreamstone Hedron
text:
{T}: Add {C}{C}{C} to your mana pool.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice Dreamstone Hedron: Draw three cards.

editions.flavor: Only the Eldrazi mind thinks in the warped paths required to open the hedrons and tap the power within.
Only the Eldrazi mind thinks in the warped paths required to open the hedrons and tap the power within.
Only the Eldrazi mind thinks in the warped paths required to open the hedrons and tap the power within.
Only the Eldrazi mind thinks in the warped paths required to open the hedrons and tap the power within.
Only the Eldrazi mind thinks in the warped paths required to open the hedrons and tap the power within.

name: Dream Thief
text:
Flying
When Dream Thief enters the battlefield, draw a card if you've cast another blue spell this turn.

editions.flavor: Awylla's salvaged dreams would finally be put to good use.

name: Dream Thrush
text:
Flying
{T}: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Whether for good or ill, their arrival always means change.

name: Dream Tides
text:
Creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may choose any number of tapped nongreen creatures he or she controls and pay {2} for each creature chosen this way. If the player does, untap those creatures.

name: Dream Twist
text:
Target player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Flashback {1}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Dreamwinder
text:
Dreamwinder can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
{U}, Sacrifice an Island: Target land becomes an Island until end of turn.

name: Dredge
text:
Sacrifice a creature or land.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"I'd strip away the world to see what's under it, but I'd never just leave it to these Phyrexian parasites and their false god."
—Urborg witch

name: Dreg Mangler
text:
Haste
Scavenge {3}{B}{G} ({3}{B}{G}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Put a number of +1/+1 counters equal to this card's power on target creature. Scavenge only as a sorcery.)

editions.flavor:
"On our thirty-fourth day of digging, we unearthed a chamber that contained the intact remains of several species long extinct from Grixis. One in particular should make a fine siege engine . . . ."
—Last notes of Shungus Nod, fleshcrafter

name: Dregscape Zombie
text: Unearth {B} ({B}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

editions.flavor: The undead of Grixis are fueled by their hatred of the living.
The undead of Grixis are fueled by their hatred of the living.
The undead of Grixis are fueled by their hatred of the living.
The undead of Grixis are fueled by their hatred of the living.

name: Dregs of Sorrow
text: Destroy X target nonblack creatures. Draw X cards.

editions.flavor: Crovax gazed on the dead, and for one dark moment he saw a banquet.
Crovax gazed upon the dead, and for one dark moment he saw a banquet.

"We live for a thousand years. The death of even one brings untold sorrow."
—Elvish elder

name: Drekavac
text: When Drekavac enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a noncreature card.

editions.flavor: Like a vulture's scalp, the face of a drekavac is oily and hairless. The filth and disease of its carrion diet slip off its blood-slick skin.

name: Drelnoch
text: Whenever Drelnoch becomes blocked, you may draw two cards.

editions.flavor: Adarkar's blank wastes make the mind wander—and stray thoughts are quickly caught and devoured.

name: Drifter il-Dal
text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Drifter il-Dal unless you pay {U}.

editions.flavor: They study the deeds of their traitorous ancestors, hoping the stories may reveal a way back to the physical world.

name: Drifting Djinn
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Drifting Djinn unless you pay {1}{U}.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

name: Drifting Meadow
text:
Drifting Meadow enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

name: Drifting Shade
text:
Flying
{B}: Drifting Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: It stalks the fens by the light of the full moon, gathering shadows as it floats among them.

name: Drift of Phantasms
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
Transmute {1}{U}{U} ({1}{U}{U}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

name: Drift of the Dead
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Drift of the Dead's power and toughness are each equal to the number of snow lands you control.

editions.flavor:
"Take their dead, and entomb them in the snow. Risen, they shall serve a new purpose."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

"Take their dead, and entomb them in the snow. Risen, they shall serve a new purpose."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

"Take their dead, and entomb them in the snow. Risen, they shall serve a new purpose."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Drill-Skimmer
text:
Flying
Drill-Skimmer has shroud as long as you control another artifact creature. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

editions.flavor: In close proximity, their magnetic energies merge and form a field of protection.

name: Drinker of Sorrow
text:
Drinker of Sorrow can't block.
Whenever Drinker of Sorrow deals combat damage, sacrifice a permanent.

editions.flavor: It strikes at your soul, heedless of your prayers.

name: Dripping Dead
text:
Dripping Dead can't block.
Whenever Dripping Dead deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.

editions.flavor: It oozes death from every pore.

name: Dripping-Tongue Zubera
text: When Dripping-Tongue Zubera dies, create a 1/1 colorless Spirit creature token for each Zubera that died this turn.

editions.flavor: When the Honden of Life's Web was destroyed, its attendants swarmed Kamigawa to ensure mortal defeat.

name: Driver of the Dead
text: When Driver of the Dead dies, return target creature card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.

editions.flavor: Some vampires resorted to corpse trading after cathars burned their estates and drove them from their ancestral feeding grounds.
Some vampires resorted to corpse trading after cathars burned their estates and drove them from their ancestral feeding grounds.
Some vampires resorted to corpse trading after cathars burned their estates and drove them from their ancestral feeding grounds.

name: Drogskol Captain
text:
Flying
Other Spirit creatures you control get +1/+1 and have hexproof. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

editions.flavor: Dead or alive, true leaders can inspire an entire army.

name: Drogskol Cavalry
text:
Flying
Whenever another Spirit enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 2 life.
{3}{W}: Create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.

name: Drogskol Reaver
text:
Flying, double strike, lifelink
Whenever you gain life, draw a card.

editions.flavor: Wracked and warped with anguish, it obsessively seeks out other souls to hoard within its eternal prison.

name: Drogskol Shieldmate
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Drogskol Shieldmate enters the battlefield, other creatures you control get +0/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "I will join you so that you will not yet join me."

name: Dromad Purebred
text: Whenever Dromad Purebred is dealt damage, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"I have seen much from the back of my dromad, most of it terribly wrong. The more I see, the more I am convinced of the rightness of my path."
—Heruj, Selesnya initiate

name: Dromar's Attendant
text: {1}, Sacrifice Dromar's Attendant: Add {W}{U}{B} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: "Dromar is the wings of the ur-dragon, sweeping away all opposition."

name: Dromar's Cavern
text:
When Dromar's Cavern enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return a non-Lair land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {W}, {U}, or {B} to your mana pool.

name: Dromar's Charm
text:
Choose one —
• You gain 5 life.
• Counter target spell.
• Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Wisdom can be summed up in two rules: Control what you can. Eliminate what you cannot."
—Dromar, the Banisher

name: Dromar, the Banisher
text:
Flying
Whenever Dromar, the Banisher deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{U}. If you do, choose a color, then return all creatures of that color to their owners' hands.

name: Dromoka Captain
text:
First strike
Whenever Dromoka Captain attacks, bolster 1. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

editions.flavor: "We fight not out of fear, but for honor."

name: Dromoka Dunecaster
text: {1}{W}, {T}: Tap target creature without flying.

editions.flavor: "The dragonlords rule the tempests of the skies. Here in the wastes, the storms are mine to command."

name: Dromoka Monument
text:
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.
{4}{G}{W}: Dromoka Monument becomes a 4/4 green and white Dragon artifact creature with flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Dromoka rules her clan from the Great Aerie atop Arashin, the central city of the Shifting Wastes.

name: Dromoka's Command
text:
Choose two —
• Prevent all damage target instant or sorcery spell would deal this turn.
• Target player sacrifices an enchantment.
• Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
• Target creature you control fights target creature you don't control.

name: Dromoka's Gift
text: Bolster 4. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put four +1/+1 counters on it.)

editions.flavor: The simplest gift from a dragon can be a revered accolade for a human warrior.

name: Dromoka, the Eternal
text:
Flying
Whenever a Dragon you control attacks, bolster 2. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put two +1/+1 counters on it.)

editions.flavor:
"The bane of countless shattered weapons, each a failure to slay her."
—Daghatar the Adamant

"The bane of countless shattered weapons, each a failure to slay her."
—Daghatar the Adamant

"The bane of countless shattered weapons, each a failure to slay her."
—Daghatar the Adamant
Dromoka has regard for the humans who serve under her. In return for her protection, they obey with steadfast loyalty, acting as weapons for her and her scalelords against the other clans.
